alert.note: Alert for Camden; Currituck (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 5:40PM EDT until May 04 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Camden County in northeastern North Carolina... Northwestern Currituck County in northeastern North Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 539 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Moyock, or near Camden, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Indiantown around 550 PM EDT. Currituck around 555 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Barco, Belcross, Coinjock, Snowden, Waterlily, Gregory, Sligo, Lambs Corner, Maple and Shawboro. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
